structuralFindings.rationale: Based on existing specimen classification. New observations from earnings/research session.
structuralFindings.aiTeamStructure: Daniel Marcu joined Goldman Sachs in March 2025 as Partner in the Engineering division and Global Head of AI Engineering and Science. He oversees AI platform and product development, working alongside Goldman Sachs does NOT have a Chief AI Officer. Instead, CIO Marco Argenti (former Amazon VP/CTO) serves as the de facto AI strategy leader, driving firmwide AI deployment including the GS AI Assistan Goldman's ~12,000 developers use AI coding assistants (GitHub Copilot and similar tools) integrated into VS Code and JetBrains IDEs. Productivity gains reported at 20-40% for standard coding tasks. In CIO Argenti argues that 'AI natives' (generation entering workforce who grew up with generative AI) are uniquely positioned to lead AI transformation. Rather than displacing junior roles, agentic AI e A Goldman Sachs survey of 100+ investment bankers in late October 2025 found that 37% of clients are using AI for regular production, with adoption expected to hit 50% next year and 74% within three y

quotes.text: We're asking all of our people to rethink the human processes they go through. And then we're making investments in AI and agentic AI to accelerate change.
quotes.speaker: Denis Coleman
quotes.context: Describing OneGS 3.0 approach to AI-driven process transformation

quotes.text: This is a fundamental rethinking of how we expect our people to operate at Goldman Sachs.
quotes.speaker: Denis Coleman

quotes.text: We don't want to simply add more manual processes to drive growth. We need to convert some of that effort into digitized and automated systems -- and rethink how those engines work.
quotes.speaker: Denis Coleman
quotes.context: Explaining the shift from manual scaling to AI-enabled scaling

quotes.text: At its core, it's an effort to drive more scale and more growth.
quotes.speaker: Denis Coleman
quotes.context: Framing OneGS 3.0 as growth-oriented rather than cost-cutting

quotes.text: We are focused on efficiency and leveraging AI to meaningfully transform the firm.
quotes.speaker: Denis Coleman

quotes.text: One Goldman Sachs 3.0, our new operating model propelled by Ella AI.
quotes.speaker: David Solomon
quotes.context: Announcing OneGS 3.0 at Q4 2025 earnings call

quotes.text: If we get this right, I don't think it significantly lowers the number of people we have.
quotes.speaker: David Solomon
quotes.context: Framing AI as capacity expansion not headcount reduction

quotes.text: I'm not in the job apocalypse camp.
quotes.speaker: David Solomon

quotes.text: Technology has been disrupting jobs, changing the way people work, destroying jobs, and forcing us as a vibrant economy to create new jobs for decades. It's no different this time.
quotes.speaker: David Solomon
quotes.context: Normalizing AI disruption as continuation of historical pattern

quotes.text: Changing processes in a big enterprise is hard work. And it's going to take some time.
quotes.speaker: David Solomon
quotes.context: Acknowledging difficulty of enterprise AI transformation

quotes.text: How do you take this technology and embed it in the enterprise to reimagine processes...often with fundamentally less people.
quotes.speaker: David Solomon
quotes.context: Davos 2026, describing AI's transformative potential (note: tension with 'no job apocalypse' framing)

quotes.text: Over the next five to 10 years, how is this going to affect the economy, it's hugely constructive, and the productivity gains are going to be enormous.
quotes.speaker: David Solomon
quotes.context: Davos 2026, on long-term AI economic impact

quotes.text: I can't find a CEO that I'm talking to, in any industry, that is not focused on how they can reimagine and automate processes.
quotes.speaker: David Solomon
quotes.context: Observing universal CEO focus on AI-driven process automation

quotes.text: If you take a three to five year view, it's giving us more capacity to invest in our business.
quotes.speaker: David Solomon
quotes.context: Framing AI as investment in growth capacity

quotes.text: Devin is going to be like our new employee, who's going to start doing stuff on the behalf of our developers.
quotes.speaker: Marco Argenti
quotes.context: Announcing Devin autonomous AI coder deployment

quotes.text: Engineers are going to be expected to have the ability to really describe problems in a coherent way and turn it into prompts, and then be able to supervise the work of those agents.
quotes.speaker: Marco Argenti
quotes.context: Describing how developer roles evolve with AI agents

quotes.text: Today marks an important moment in our AI journey as we are excited to announce the firmwide launch of the GS AI Assistant -- the first generative AI-powered tool to reach this scale.
quotes.speaker: Marco Argenti
quotes.context: Announcing firmwide GS AI Assistant rollout

quotes.text: We have the entire organization that needs to re-tune and re-tool itself for AI.
quotes.speaker: Marco Argenti
quotes.context: On the organizational transformation required for AI

quotes.text: You can delegate work, but you cannot delegate accountability.
quotes.speaker: Marco Argenti

summary: OneGS 3.0: Firmwide AI-driven operating model overhaul: Goldman Sachs launched 'One Goldman Sachs 3.0' (OneGS 3.0) as a multiyear overhaul of its operating model, announced at Q4 2025 earnings (Jan 15, 2026). The initiative is described as 'propelled by El Six OneGS 3.0 workstreams target specific operational processes: The six workstreams target processes including: client onboarding, KYC (know your customer), sales enablement, lending processes, regulatory reporting, and vendor management. Solomon described these a AI leadership troika: Marcu (AI Engineering & Science), Sharma (AI Platform), Xiang (AI Research): Daniel Marcu joined Goldman Sachs in March 2025 as Partner in the Engineering division and Global Head of AI Engineering and Science. He oversees AI platform and product development, working alongside CIO Marco Argenti as de facto AI strategy lead (no Chief AI Officer title): Goldman Sachs does NOT have a Chief AI Officer. Instead, CIO Marco Argenti (former Amazon VP/CTO) serves as the de facto AI strategy leader, driving firmwide AI deployment including the GS AI Assistan
openQuestions: What is the actual annual technology spend? The known '$6B' figure needs verification -- Bank Automation News reported $1.9B tech spend in 2023. Is $6B total including compensation, or just non-comp tech spend? Or has it grown substantially?
Who does Daniel Marcu report to? Most likely Marco Argenti (CIO) but not explicitly confirmed in any source
What is 'Ella AI' exactly? Solomon named it at Q4 earnings as propelling OneGS 3.0, but no details found on whether it's a rebrand of GS AI Assistant, a new agentic platform, or an internal codename
What are all six operational workstreams? We confirmed: onboarding, KYC, sales enablement, lending, regulatory reporting, vendor management -- but different sources give slightly different lists
How does Dinesh Gupta (global head of AI and digitization since 2022) relate to Daniel Marcu (global head of AI engineering and science since 2025)? Potential overlap or supersession?
What is the AI steering group composition? Argenti mentioned it evaluates 'dozens of proposals' but no detail on membership or governance structure
50% of 46,000 employees had AI access by mid-2025 -- what's the current adoption rate as of Q4 2025/Q1 2026?
The 'Shark Tank'-style developer innovation competitions -- how are these structured, how often, who judges, what happens to winning ideas?
